rollbackConditions: If fills remain at 0 over the next hour after changes are applied.
If increased fills result in negative markout beyond acceptable thresholds.
reasoningTrace: The fill count is 0, indicating that spreads might be too wide, preventing successful trades.
Reducing 'baseHalfSpreadBps' by 10% from 10 to 9 bps could encourage more fills by narrowing the spread slightly.
Decreasing 'refreshIntervalMs' by 10% from 1000 to 900 ms will make the bot more responsive, potentially capturing more favorable market conditions with quicker quote updates.
If the changes do not lead to increased fills or if fills occur with negative markout, rollback conditions will be triggered to revert to safer parameters.
